content: That's really insightful. I've noticed that many Korean thrillers tend to have a strong focus on character development and social commentary, which sets them apart from other countries' thrillers. I think that's one of the reasons why I enjoyed "Hellbound" so much - it wasn't just a mindless action film, but it also explored some deeper themes. Do you think this focus on character development is a result of Korean culture's emphasis on community and social harmony?
